9.5/10

Longer portal 1 with very nice story and some nice challenging puzzles though for the most part it's super easy and requires literally zero effort/thought thanks to valves design, where they ensure even mindless babies can play their games with flying colours. Because the length, 15AUD is a very good ask for a neat charming game, and it also goes on stupid cheap sale every now and then - no reason not to buy it at sale cost.
Yeah you need to buy this game. I used to doubt myself when it came to puzzle platformers. Now that I completed Portal 2, I feel more confident in my abilities to complete these types of games.

Great game, challenging and I love the humor of the game. Just a fun game to play and exercises your brain.

Awesome game! Very good voice acting, really put the soul into the machines, turrets voice lines almost break my heart. Outstanding sound design and soundtracks. Puzzle are not too hard and feels satisfying, even my dumbass can figured it all out from start to finish. Great writing, good humor. No gun, no mindless shooting, just your brain and portal device (but still managed to have good boss fight tho), oh and wicked humor. All-in-all a very simple game with surprisingly good gameplay. Valve killed it! Waiting for the number "3" from them.
Amazing game, even after you finish single player, multiplayer is so much fun!
A great game, the story is a solid 9/10 and the multiplayer is great.

This is legitimately one of my favorite games ever. I entered blind, never having played Portal (or any Valve game, for that matter) and exited astounded. I played it first on PS3 after a very turbulent month, being evacuated from a wildfire, and received it through the post office while on evacuation with no access to the PS3. Given the circumstances, I was more excited to play it at that point than I ever was before.

So what makes Portal 2 so great? It's a multitude of things.

Firstly, its story. I had not played Portal prior to my initial playthrough of its sequel, but everything was crystal clear to me as an outsider. I had no idea of the history surrounding Aperture or GLaDOS or any of these countless other things, but the stellar writing ensures that you can still understand the story regardless. GLaDOS's ruthless quips at Chell are hilarious as always, and the comic relief Wheatley serves during the head-end of the game help anchor you to some intrinsic sense of reality that's foggier elsewhere throughout its runtime.

The gameplay is perfect. Having played Portal now, I can see that 2 is a remarkable improvement to the first game's formula. The thing is, though, the second game can also stand on its own, at least as far as gameplay goes. The queues provided throughout visuals and audio guides help to give you just enough of a link to tie each test's loose ends together, and the satisfaction brought forth with success and hearing GLaDOS insult you for your efforts is always a delight. This isn't even beginning to consider the co-op mode, which is just as solid as the campaign.

This game hit me at a very impressionable time and it still hasn't really gotten out of me. It's a textbook lesson in Valve's classic 'show, don't tell' design philosophy that starts really strong and finishes just as well. Its characters are as lovable and quotable today as they were in 2011, and the story's plunges into the depths of Aperture Laboratories are still as engaging as they've ever been. This game is a must-play for anybody. Incredible.
Probably close to the best game of all time

This game is one of my favorite games of all time.  It looks good and plays even better.  The gameplay is well designed for singleplayer and multiplayer play.  The slow reveal of the plot and the fate of old aperature is engaging and the game is easy to get lost in.  The puzzles are well designed and the game overall holds up very well.

[h1]Bienvenidos, caballeros, a Aperture Science.[/h1]

Portal 2 tiene que ser sinceramente uno de los mejores juegos jam√°s creados. Ya sea te gusten o no los juegos de [i]puzzles[/i], no puedes disimular esa satisfacci√≥n que obtienes al gritar [i]Eureka![/i] una vez resuelves la sala que tanto problema te estaba dando, solo para darte cuenta de lo f√°cil que era la soluci√≥n.

La historia es incre√≠blemente inmersiva, te engancha desde el primer minuto y, a medida que vas desvelando los secretos, no puedes parar de investigar y curiosear por el entorno que est√° lleno de pistas, mensajes y rayados de lo que parece fueron ser otros sujetos de prueba como tu. Sentirte solo, pero a la vez observado en un escenario, es una de las mejores sensaciones que logra transmitir Portal.
